website_summaries.verdict: The best printer on the market. Easily copes with the demands of home and office.
pros: Fast and extremely versatile machine offering scanning, copying, and faxing, plus wireless printing from smartphones or tablets

customer_reviews.title: THIS PRINTER STINKS!!!
customer_reviews.text: Had an old deskjet that lasted 17 years. THEY DON'T MAKE THEM LIKE THEY USED TO!!! This printer stinks. #1 - It never fails to stop printing from the desktop that it is wirelessly connected to. MULTIPLE reinstallations does not help...THERE IS NO SOLUTION. #2 - Print quality is horrible. It's like a little kids printer. I highly suggest spending more money on a printer that works. DO NOT BUY ON AMAZON because return will be impossible when it starts acting up ( 2months after you've bought it. AVOID!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: J. Palmer

customer_reviews.title: printer works but for the love of god leave me alone with the HP instant ...
customer_reviews.text: printer works but for the love of god leave me alone with the HP instant ink enrollment, I don't need you sending me your ink. Currently the screen on the printer won't change from the annoying reminder that i am not fully enrolled in their program. I even set up the printer with it in mind that I wanted nothing to do with instant ink, but sure enough, here i am, getting badgered by HP to sign up for their ink program on the printer itself. Do yourself a favor and rid yourself of printers in your home. annoying.
customer_reviews.author: Brenda Battaglia

customer_reviews.title: Excellent operation and print quality. Wi-Fi works well, and features are complete. Recommended!
customer_reviews.text: I've been very happy with this printer for my small office. All the features work without issue, and print quality is very high. I didn't really fall for the auto refill hype, though I'm sure some offices that have a good idea how much they use their printer on a daily basis, might have better use of that opportunity. The printer is relatively quiet in operation, and fairly quick first print. All controls are on touch screen and work well. Document loader works without jamming, and the wireless system is flawless. Very pleased that I purchased this printer, and recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Frank E. TrinkleTop Contributor: Gardening

customer_reviews.title: Nasty HP.
customer_reviews.text: The set-up process is intentionally made difficult, sometimes not providing crucial information necessary to complete the process, without subscribing to their automatic ink resupply plan. Nasty, nasty business. As soon as I realized what was happening, I surely wasn't going to subscribe to their ink plan, come hell or high water.
customer_reviews.author: Eugene F Cater

customer_reviews.title: I changed my Review of this printer from a One to a Five Star.....See why
customer_reviews.text: At first, I had rated this printer only One Star, with the below review. HOWEVER HP was so good at helping me fix the Problem, I want to Upgrade to a Five Star. Thank you,HP! "The 8720 is Truly a Disappointment , to say the least! I had to spend $200 just to get it to work 'out of the box'. Note that is $30 MORE than the purchase price. At first, it printed from both the MacBook Pro and the iPhone 2 or 3 times, it Outright Quit! Despite multiple re-boots of all devices involved, there was no resurrecting the printer out of abject refusal to print. Go back to whatever printer Brand used to work for You"
customer_reviews.author: Jano

customer_reviews.title: Good printer, but it's an ink hog.
customer_reviews.text: I've owned the Office Jet Pro 8720 for more than 9 months. Aside from an occasional paper mishandling, print quality is very good. It prints well on various paper sizes and envelopes. I've had no problem with wireless printing. My gripe is that it uses way more ink than advertised. Most of our printing is low density text rather than images, but we get less than half the advertised yield from standard and XL cartridges.
customer_reviews.author: Duane

customer_reviews.title: An expensive waste of time
customer_reviews.text: Beware -- if you buy this "wireless" printer, you will spend more time troubleshooting it and waiting for it to "find" the network (the exact same network it was on 20 minutes before). Every. Single. Time. HP "support" is useless. I really regret buying this piece of junk. I don't see any advantage for our small home office to having a wireless printer when the wireless feature rarely works and I don't even have the option of connecting it directly to the computer.
customer_reviews.author: BookMom

customer_reviews.title: Fast and pretty cheap to use
customer_reviews.text: I want to give this 4 stars but just can't. The one star is because it constantly goes "offline" and needs to be turned off and on again and sometimes reinstalled. I've had 3 generations of this printer and the 2nd was an improvement over the 1st. Fast and pretty cheap to use. The constant need to re-set makes this really tough to use. I've upgraded the firmware a couple of times in the past year and no fix for this. I am also far from the only one complaining about this. I hate to say this, but STAY AWAY until HP fixes it. Yes, the pop-ups to join HP's ink program are annoying too but can be stopped.
customer_reviews.author: Al

customer_reviews.title: but once up and running it was great. I thought
customer_reviews.text: I bought this after reading some reviews that said it was hard to set up, but once up and running it was great. I thought, 'oh, well, a little set-up hassle is worth a good printer at a decent price.' How wrong I was!! I basically don't have a printer at this point. All the hassle with set-up was true and I've had to go through all the same hassles every time i wish to print- occassionally succesfully, slowly, but nice turn out when it happens. This printer will be donated somewhere and I will feel mixed about saddling them with this. I am an otherwise happy HP fan.
customer_reviews.author: Kate M.

customer_reviews.title: Another crappy product from HP
customer_reviews.text: This printer worked great until recently. For some unknown reason, It started cutting off the headers and shifting the body of the text below the bottom of the page. This could not be fixed. I tried to uninstall the program and do a clean reinstall, but I cannot uninstall the software. To top it off, I can't reinstall the software or do a repair. I downloaded the latest version of the software from hp.com. No good. I'm tired of HP and it's shoddy products that seem programmed to fail right after warranty ends.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Monts

customer_reviews.title: Lasted just over 1 year - document jammed in the document feeder - NOT!
customer_reviews.text: Just over a year we started to get a message that there is a document jammed in the document feeder, which there isn't. Initially, this was intermittent and now it is a permanent error. We've tried cleaning the unit as well as followed all of the reset recommendations on the HP website with no success. This printer was not used extensively or very hard. We would expect a HP printer to last at least a few years if not longer. Given they charge significantly for ink, you would think they would want their printers to work forever not giving the buyer a need to switch to another vendor!
customer_reviews.author: JoRo

customer_reviews.title: Excellent All-in-one Machine
customer_reviews.text: My previous HP all-in-one was an excellent machine and lasted more than 10 years. Knowing how lacking QC can be, regardless of the manufacturer, I was not looking forward to the process of choosing a new printer. I've had this printer for almost a year. I can say I am thrilled with the purchase of the HP OfficeJet 8720. It has surpassed my expectations with lightning fast printing, superior imaging, quiet operation, and reliable connectivity. I would feel confident in recommending this printer to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: tooblue

customer_reviews.title: Bigger than expected but a great low cost printer (ink cartridges and physical printer)
customer_reviews.text: Bigger than expected but a great low cost printer (ink cartridges and physical printer). There was no need to change and "upgrade" the HP OfficeJet Pro 8600 which had a smaller footprint, same size touch display screen and was lighter. I had one downstairs and wanted the same for my home office (for ease of replacing ink cartridges etc). But unfortunately that one is discontinued and being sold at 3 times the original price - this one has the exact same style and size of ink cartridges except for a tiny groove that does not make them inter changeable. That is annoying because you know they only did that for the ink cartridge market/profit margin!
customer_reviews.author: TimeBandit

customer_reviews.title: bad experience with apple connection
customer_reviews.text: This is perhaps a good printer. But the connection issues are definitely show stoppers. It cannot make a simple USB connection to my Apple macbook. It din't connect to my airport router either. The print quality is great, though. I was only able to print through email which is terrible.
customer_reviews.author: pacificUser

customer_reviews.title: Just bought in March and now dead....
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this the first time on Oct. 18, 2016. I had it about 2 years and it started acting up and finally quit working. I purchased the same printer, as I liked it overall....just felt is sure didn't last very long. I purchased this one Mar 13 of this year (2019) and now...only 5 months later, it will not shut off or turn on. It is lit up, but on/off switch does not work, and it is basically dead. Would love a response from Amazon...
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great printer
customer_reviews.text: While the printer is extra large, I wanted a quality printer this time around and I have not been disappointed. Set up was pretty simple and it has worked for two weeks now without a hitch. It was rated so high, I am hoping for great things. One thing I was shocked about is the cost of the ink. Hopefully I will find that it lasts a long time since it's the highest I have seen. So, I will know in a few months whether there is just a much higher capacity for it to justify the cost. The price of the printer itself was amazing. So I am optimistic I have made one really great purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Trish

customer_reviews.title: Works great until it doesn't
customer_reviews.text: Not sure why I decided to give HP another shot by purchasing this printer. After it printed just fine a few days ago and I now get the error "the printhead appears to be missing not detected or incorrectly installed" Since I never opened the printer since it worked last I can't fathom how this error can occur. After following all of the HP steps including updating the printer, the only solution they have is to purchase a new printerhead. Why? Probably because these products are meant to fail so that you purchase more. DO NOT BUY THIS PRODUCT
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy

customer_reviews.title: Expensive Unreliable Crap
customer_reviews.text: I bought this printer last April, and I believe a nearly $200 printer should last longer than 9 months. It gives the following error message "One or more cartridges are missing or damaged." Not sure how this happened but after replacing all four cartridges, the message persists. Tried a factory reset to no avail. Tried leaving it unplugged for a day, no change. I will never again spend more than $100 on a printer.
customer_reviews.author: Tight Wad

customer_reviews.title: An Excellent All-Purpose Printer
customer_reviews.text: Somewhat a bulky all-purpose printer, however loaded with excellent features and a large touch screen. Prints are high quality and the printing speed is great. The top loading facility is convenient and the wireless connection works well. When connecting for wireless operation, it did not connect at the 5 GHz frequency we had available in our wi-fi, but automatically chose the lower frequency. Ink usage is economical and the two sided-printing is easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Kaspar

customer_reviews.title: 10% of pages are blurry + cannot do duplex on Mac
customer_reviews.text: 10% of the pages come up completely blurry and need to be reprinted. UPDATE: customer support sent a new print head - be ready for 1hr of back and forth message and emails for a few days - but the problem persists. Not sure if it's a lemon, the product was new from HP. I bought new cartridges and did ink alignment/cleaned print head. Customer support would not send a new printer. This printer is basically useless for home use. UPDATE 2: 2 years after ownership and the software still is deficient, not allowing me to print duplex on OSX/Mac without having to open the printer menu. Blurry prints still occur at random.
customer_reviews.author: Tony G.

customer_reviews.title: Maybe I just got a lemon, but, buyer beware
customer_reviews.text: The second time I had to change and in this printer, I got an error message after the change but the cartridges still needed to be changed. I played with it and tried talking with customer support, but nothing worked. I even purchased another set of cartridges to see if it was just a problem with that. I now have a junkie printer, I’ve spent a lot of money on it, and can’t print. And, no customer support.
customer_reviews.author: J. Vance

customer_reviews.title: Slow copier, expensive ink, and poor quality print on some items.
customer_reviews.text: This is not a good product for offices that need quick copies. Takes several seconds to warm up, choose the options, and wait for it to start up. A single black ink cartridge costs over $30 and I've stopped using color because of the expense. The product has inserted itself onto my computer desktop and repeatedly tries to sell me ink, which is bothersome. I do like the print quality of letters and anything coming from my computer, but the quality of copies of other documents is so poor that I often have to use a pen to reinforce parts of it. Bad buy for my purposes!
customer_reviews.author: Sangestein

customer_reviews.title: Oh, well
customer_reviews.text: Seems pretty good in printing/scanning performance. ONCE YOU COMPLETE SETUP WITH HELP FROM CONFUSED SUPPORT. The automatic setup won't complete. The ability to print from iOS devices needs to be turned on in some secret location. The NFC feature doesn't seem to to do anything. But since all I really need is copying and printing and scanning, and it's fast for all that.
customer_reviews.author: A Wool

customer_reviews.title: Great printer and even better scanner
customer_reviews.text: Needed a new printer/copier/scanner for work. We have these in our company office. Had a small Epson but the scan function took forever and only one page at a time. Got lucky and this one was at $179 which normally for most places it is $299. Scan function is perfect, multiple pages, scan directly to my computer. Wish I had purchased this earlier.
customer_reviews.author: Shelly Turner

customer_reviews.title: One of the most disappointing HP printers I've ever owned
customer_reviews.text: First, it is NOT Mac OSX compatible, despite reassurances from HP that it is. It consistently prints a double image the first time after waking from "sleep". Customer service finally acknowledged this issue after weeks of talking with them and admitted they have no plans (idea) to fix it. Now I am getting a "blue screen of death" equivalent when I try to print multiple pages per sheet, forcing me to reset the device and complete a cartridge check which takes about 5 minutes. HP used to provide the pinnacle of home office printers. Their greed, unfortunately, has gotten in the way. Exploring options.
customer_reviews.author: William W.

customer_reviews.title: This All-In-One printer is super easy to set up and does it all!
customer_reviews.text: I needed a printer that could scan/ print multiple pages, two-sided duplex printing, and wouldn't take forever to do the job! This printer does everything I need and more. The instant ink program HP offers is awesome. It was super easy to set up the wireless / mobile printing! The printer has "how to videos" on the touch screen in case there is any questions on how to do something. I'm not a tech savvy person but this printer is super easy to use!
customer_reviews.author: SRC

customer_reviews.title: Update review 6-22-19. After months of constantly having to manually wake......
customer_reviews.text: Update 6-22-19. After fighting with this junk since November '18 I trashed it. NO MORE HP FOR ME. Every time I sent a print job I had to go to the printer and wake it up then go back to the PC. The WOL feature never worked. I had installed the HP Smart app. That didn't help. I had bought 3 of these. One for me, one for my church, and one for a relative. All 3 have had problems with connectivity.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry

customer_reviews.title: Great! I can't believe this was so cheap
customer_reviews.text: Great! I can't believe this was so cheap. It does everything I need, effortlessly. And wifi connection was almost automatic. Both windows pc and all my apple devices recognize it. 2 sided printing works good. Colors are very good match to photos or computer pics used. Carts and paper easy to load. Prints fast. I would have spent much more for a printer (as I have in the past) but this one has all the features I need and works flawlessly so far. The color control screen is very informative, and tracks updates, ink used, paper, etc. I don't use the copy feature or scanner, so can't comment on those, but every thing else is very efficient.
customer_reviews.author: Rich of California

customer_reviews.title: Average quality; clunky, outmoded software; noisy; makes strange noises
customer_reviews.text: The software and human-machine-interface seems circa 1986 - and has since 1986. The quality and construction is the next thing before shoddy. When scanning; the light transport mechanism makes a gravelly, grating, grinding noise. I'm concerned that it's going to quit at any time. I would return it - it isn't five months old - but it's outside the 60-day Amazon return window. I need to check the HP return guarantee but I bought it from Amazon and the least Amazon could do is provide the same return policy as HP - which I believe is longer than 60 days.
customer_reviews.author: JoeD

customer_reviews.title: After 6 months, works great
customer_reviews.text: Replaced an 8710 whose automatic feeder did not work. Have had the 8720 for 6 months and everything works great. Prints fast, scans wirelessly to my laptop, etc. No problems to date. The printer is so smart that is you try to grab the printed paper too soon it displays a message telling you not to touch the paper yet. HaHa. Of course all HP products come with constant harassment from HP that wants to take over your life and demand that you buy buy buy......I just ignore all their stupid marketing. The printer works great. That's all that matters.
customer_reviews.author: Harry B.

customer_reviews.title: If you want to wait days for your materials then buy it if not don't waste your money
customer_reviews.text: This printer is slow. If you want to wait days for your materials then buy it if not don't waste your money. I have used cheap 50.oo printers that are faster than this. It is also very loud when printing. It was easy to set up it took minutes to do that and print quality is what you would expect for an ink jet printer.
customer_reviews.author: M. Packard

customer_reviews.title: scanner and auto feed
customer_reviews.text: I only had this printer for a few months, use it at home and very little. The scanner, which I rarely use, gets stuck about half way through the scan. The auto feeder grabs a pile of papers, they get stuck and have to be removed, it is useless. So disappointed in this printer. Had some important documents to scan and reproduce copies, the printer absolutely wouldn't cooperate!
customer_reviews.author: John Chamberlin

customer_reviews.title: printer  design
customer_reviews.text: Arrived in great shape and works well at this time. Not totally crazy about the design because the paper tray sticks 8" beyond the printer and cannot be slipped back into the printer like the 8600 model. This causes me to be bump it. It does make changing the ink easier but am not sure that compromising compact size for easier ink changing is worth the difference.
customer_reviews.author: hollis101

customer_reviews.title: bought the printer, it came with only test ink ...
customer_reviews.text: bought the printer, it came with only test ink cartridges. i joined the "instant ink.. only to find they charged me for a new set of ink after i just bought some new ink , so i dropped the membership and now the ink i bought will not work because im not in the instant ink scam you out of your money. buy Kodak printers they even supply you with REAL ink cartridges you can use.
customer_reviews.author: joseph m bryant

customer_reviews.title: Dissapointed
customer_reviews.text: Not a fan of my printer replacement. I bought this printer to replace my Officejet 8600 that stopped scanning with recent software update. I am a occasional user of the print function but use the scanner more regularly. Unfortunately, the scanning function is a weak point. The document feeder jams most of the time when I try to do duplex scans. It is also a very loud machine in both the print function and the scanning function. I own it and I'll use it but I would not recommend it to anybody. There are better multi function printers on the market.
customer_reviews.author: John B

customer_reviews.title: Defective Product! Do not buy!
customer_reviews.text: STAY AWAY! Defective product. Very disappointed with this product. I purchased for my work office to replace an older HP printer. After setting this up everything seemed to be working properly. I tried to scan something and then the printer displayed a blue power error and then shut off. I contacted the manufacturer and they guided me to try and fix it. We updated the printer and then it seemed to work. However shortly after the printer did it again. Frustrated with it I exchanged it with a new one from amazon. After receiving and setting the replacement up, the printer started turning off again after scanning. Clearly a defective product. Won’t recommend purchasing at all.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed that this was sold as a "new" printer when ...
customer_reviews.text: This printer had already been opened by someone else but was sold as a new product to me. Nothing was taped closed, the pint cartridges were already in the printer and shocking but it didn't work. Very disappointed that this was sold as a "new" printer when obviously it was returned by a previous customer.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer DeGirolomo

customer_reviews.title: Great product, excellent quality prints
customer_reviews.text: Prints well, with crisp edges on text, and great on photos. The speed is very good for an inkjet printer, and it does have a quiet setting that does reduce the noise and vibration somewhat. The front and back printing makes printing booklets, newsletters, etc. a breeze. No more struggling with which end or which side of the page to flip for two-sided printing. I will be using the self-ordering ink feature in the future, as it is more economical, not to mention, convenient. Over-all, I am quite pleased with the HP printer. We have always been devoted to Epson prior to this, but may be converts to HP now.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Muir-Chamberlain

customer_reviews.title: Good printer
customer_reviews.text: Replaced another older HP that CONSTANTLY jammed. This one has not, yet. I like the way the paper shoots back up in to the printer when finished. My old printer spit it onto the floor. WiFi was easily setup and worked well from the start. The startup/first-use test and setup took a long long time. I thought it was stuck or something, but it worked itself out and has been great for a few months now, no problems.
customer_reviews.author: E. Lee

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: At 13 months the scan feature working no so good. Print quality not so good with black ink. Swapped out cartriges multiple times to get black from streaking ultimately it would be necessary to buy a new ink head for the same cost as printer. Not a chance, I have 3 other HPs a 225 laser great unit, 7550 also great, and 8630 still working great I really don't like this 8720 worst HP I've owned. I'm just throwing it out at this point. Probably the first one to get thrown out with less than 1000 copies.
customer_reviews.author: MTSNJ

customer_reviews.title: Consumer Reports rated this a best buy. They must not have used more than ...
customer_reviews.text: What a pain! The printer constantly shuts off from the network and won't print or scan until you shut it off and restart it. The Scan Doctor is a total joke and does no help at all. HP customer support is also a joke if you can even get someone that speaks English clear enough to understand. Consumer Reports rated this a best buy. They must not have used more than a few days because the problems started about 2 months after I bought it. I also saw similar complaints on this product. No more HP for me in the future. Company is going down hill.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Complete waste of money - can't use it in our small office
customer_reviews.text: Printer is terrible. Connection issues, drivers print collated paged in reverse order, extremely slow. We stopped using it almost immediately, even as a backup. Useless and send to the dumpster, lesson learned. Even if this was a lemon, it has convinced us never to buy HP again.
customer_reviews.author: isecond

customer_reviews.title: I call my printer 'Big Poppa'.
customer_reviews.text: I read the reviews prior to purchase, so I knew what to expect with the size of this printer and it was not an issue for where I intended to keep it, but if that is a consideration for you, do take the time to review the measurements. If you're expecting to put this on a desk along with your computer, you'd best have a pretty darn big desk - this printer is a big boy! That aside, the features and quality are outstanding for the price, and the setup with my Mac over the wireless network was super quick and easy.
customer_reviews.author: Book Ogre

customer_reviews.title: OK printing, scanning problematic.
customer_reviews.text: Find the scanning to be difficult in comparison to my Brother MFC. When loading the feeder and hitting the scan button on the screen I always have to adjust the default to what type of file I want it to scan to. It doesn't keep the default I set. It also makes me confirm the program on my computer before proceeding canceling out the convenience of the screen on the printer (This might be a glitch related to another program on my computer, not sure). UPDATE 2-14-19: Downloaded some software from HP that solved the problem of having to go to the computer for each scan. Now it works like I wanted it to in the first place.
customer_reviews.author: cupofjoescafe(dot)com

customer_reviews.title: Look elsewhere first
customer_reviews.text: If you have my experience, you'll be surprised at the number of ordinary print jobs for which it errors out. When it does print, the paper spool creases down the middle of the page. The print product is very good quality for the price but the cartridges that come with it will run out quickly on you. Photos print nicely but for the crease down the middle. It's a bulky printer that takes up more space than others of comparable quality. It did not meet my expectations and I would look at other printers before buying this one. I work from home and this printer is definitely not adequate for even a modest volume of work.
customer_reviews.author: Bob P.

customer_reviews.title: Not compatible
customer_reviews.text: Don't use this printer much and only now ran out of the set-up ink cartridges after purchasing the printer in 2016. Found out to my dismay that this model is supposed to be sold only in Latin America and the ink cartridges sold here in the US are incompatible. Very annoyed. Gave this purchase one star as no stars is not an option. did I say very annoyed?
customer_reviews.author: classypony

customer_reviews.title: WARNING.. GAVE OUT FALSE PAPER JAM CODE AND QUIT WORKING.
customer_reviews.text: Don't buy it !!!!!! Had for a little over 2 years. If you do, differently get the extended warranty. Was loud from a operational mechanical standpoint, and at the end of the day, I had not even run a full ream of paper thru it, when it gave me a false paper jam error message and wouldn't work. Hp was nice enough to talk me thru some reboot options, trying to clear the false error code even though my warranty was up. They then offered to replace it for over $300.00. How nice, When a new one on Amazon cost less the $200.00. I had another printer for years that worked GREAT, UNTIL WINDOWS 10 CAME ALONG. Technology is GREAT.
customer_reviews.author: S.Wilson

customer_reviews.title: So far so good. Nice prints
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. Nice prints, will do front to back, multiple pages, no jams so far. Better utilization of the ink cartridges. Hooked up easily. The only think so far is that one in a while it says it is not communicating (wireless setup) and when that pops up on my screen when I close it the printing starts.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy H.

customer_reviews.title: High Maintenance Printer
customer_reviews.text: The printer has WAY too many issues given it's price tag. My usual routine each time I have to print usually involves sending things to the printer well advance because it only prints on command 50 percent of the time. In addition, it jams 60 percent of the time requiring a full maintenance effort and then you're lucky if it prints as needed (see previous sentence). My wife has taken to only printing from her phone because from her computer is inconsistent. Not sure what the issue is but this is a lot of work for a printer that may print 10 pages/week. I plan to contact HP and will update depending on their response.
customer_reviews.author: Charles

customer_reviews.title: Buy something else unless you love frustration and letting HP have full control.
customer_reviews.text: After a year with this printer I noticed the "update to make things better" constantly showing up on screen. After updating, it erases everything. Nice job HP. Uninstalling, reinstalling all the driver, software and it still doesn't work unless I kill my firewall altogether. I also learned they send signals to the chips in the ink cartridges after a certain period of time to cripple them and force you to buy new ones. The software doesn't "find" my printer although it shows up with an IP on the screen. It's just a mess as usual. It would be great to just have a driver without having to tell HP all my business before using it.
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: You'll spend more time trying to get it to print anything, then printing
customer_reviews.text: Printer will randomly decide to go into an error state, I'll clear the queue, run the troubleshooter, restart my computer and the printer, and still no dice. HP printers have horrible device support on Windows 10 apparently. Had this same issue with coworkers on the 8620 and the 8600. Now printer has to be restarted everytime I want to print or scan something.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Garcia

customer_reviews.title: No Support on day 91
customer_reviews.text: I used to love HP. I bought this on February 4, 2018. Today is December 16, 2018. The printer started error-ing out last week, so it made it just over 300 days. I use the printer several times a week, I scan, it was great. The error came up and now comes up each time, about 15 minutes after starting up. HP Support said they cannot do anything because there is no error code. Not even bring it in for examination. Oh well. I guess I will suggest non-HP printers to my clients from now on. As someone with about 30 years in IT, I have a great many folks asking me what I use, etc.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob K

customer_reviews.title: OfficeJet Pro 8720
customer_reviews.text: I set the OfficeJet Pro 8720 up as a network printer connected with an ethernet cable to a Wi-Fi router. This required a full software installation on each of my computers, some of which are hardwired, others use Wi-Fi. The installation was easy and no problems were encountered during the setup. The print quality is not quite LaserJet standard, but is vey close and more than adequate for my needs. I frequently use the printer for scanning; it is much faster than my old OfficeJet Pro 276dw and the quality is very high. Definitely recommend this printer to anyone needing an AIO printer.
customer_reviews.author: Lynn H. Clark

customer_reviews.title: High quality and fast, takes up 3ft of desk space
customer_reviews.text: Fast printer, easy to print via cloud and from iphone/ipad. Scan to computer works with little technical knowledge. Ink is a bit expensive, but has lasted months vs the expected weeks. My reason its not 5 stars is just the LARGE footprint, it's about 3 feet wide, 3 feet high, and 4 feet deep. Takes up quite a bit of space on a desk.
customer_reviews.author: AdventureMK

customer_reviews.title: Incapable of printing on cardstock, good enough on plain paper.
customer_reviews.text: I am surprised that a printer from a company like HP has such a hard time with something so simple. It is good enough on plain paper. Not great but there is nothing to either complain about or rave about in daily use. Just stick to plain paper and it will work well enough.
customer_reviews.author: Dave F.

customer_reviews.title: Failed to work out of the box
customer_reviews.text: Brand new, out of the box, and won't print without false paper jams. I performed all the recommended tests and procedures on it and it was finally determined to be a hardware issue. After an hour on chat with cust. svc., I was told they would send me a refurbished unit. Yes, it would come with the remainder of my warranty (11 months), but refurbished? I haven't even been able to use this machine yet. Two stars now, we'll see after I get the replacement whether it warrants a new review.
customer_reviews.author: Deborah Cain

customer_reviews.title: Only Prints on Plain Paper?!
customer_reviews.text: Just a Warning to those that may need to use this printer for other than Plain Paper. This printer does not pick up Card stock paper to print. Check the forums for confirmation. Users have had to tilt the printer to get it to feed card stock, then it will not print on both sides. At one point a customer was told to feed 1 sheet at a time so the printer would not jam. For a printer this expensive it should work fine. I have been a loyal HP Printer user for years, but I think my next printer will not be HP.
customer_reviews.author: Robert B McGuire Jr

customer_reviews.title: Pleased with this printer.
customer_reviews.text: In use for a few months. Works great. One computer connected via USB cable, one connected via network. Note that if using Ethernet, the wireless connection is disabled. It does not support both Ethernet cable and wireless networking at the same time. I have not run into a printer that does.
customer_reviews.author: b

customer_reviews.title: Unless your OK buying only HP ink cartridges only, Don't buy this printer.
customer_reviews.text: So the scanner interface is really good which I use a lot. The print portion is not so great. Had an issue with the printer so I upgraded the firmware to fix it, or so I thought. It now requires "Official" HP print cartridge. So now I can't even get past the setup screen to see if it even fixed the problem since I don't currently have HP cartridges. Now I have a printer/scanner that does nothing, can even scan anymore. So either I spend $100 on HP ink to see if it even fixes the problem or I dump it and buy a completely new system. Problem is I can't even scan, which I use heavily.
customer_reviews.author: Jarvi

customer_reviews.title: Well-featured
customer_reviews.text: Scan, fax, print, copy. Flat bed or document feeder. The only downsides are the bloated HP software to get everything to work, and the pitches for the "auto refill" ink subscription. Were it not for someone spec'ing an inkjet, I'd have bought them a color laser printer... The print quality was nice, but it'll remain to be seen how long the ink lasts, and what happens when the printer is left unused for a few weeks because the client is traveling.
customer_reviews.author: D. S. Greenberg

customer_reviews.title: great it support from amazon
customer_reviews.text: Awesome printer, Had an issue because I didn't use the CD to set it up. Went back to my order on Amazon, clicked the Need help button for a "return call now" and my phone instantly rang. Nick from amazon (working in the phillipines) He walked me through the entire process, I accidentally disconnected us and he called me right back. This took 45 minutes and now my scanner is up and running perfectly. WAY TO GO AMAZON SUPPORT!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! Couldn't believe the help he was! Sincerely, Happy Amazon prime customer and purchases of everything on Amazon including vacuum cleaner bags!
customer_reviews.author: Karen Clendenin

customer_reviews.title: Not the quality that I was expecting.
customer_reviews.text: This printer keeps jamming in the back and I do not see any broken part or other reason why this happens. If I ever buy this product again, I think I will purchase an extended warranty. This is not the cheapest printer available and it still failed within nine months of purchase. Disappointing that HP does not offer a one year warranty on these mid-priced printers. In the eight-month time window it was working, it worked very well. Sudden failure without any abuse and without excessive printing. Not good value for the money considering how soon after purchase it failed.
customer_reviews.author: Meena Willard

customer_reviews.title: Unreliable product with poor support. Avoid
customer_reviews.text: The product is unreliable and the support does not exist. HP has a poorly designed computer generate “chat” as it’s help capabilities are non existent. It is touch and go if it is online or not. I spent time restarting computers and printers just to print a document. Save yourself grief, buy another product
customer_reviews.author: David Harris

customer_reviews.title: ... always used HP printers but the last one just like this one was a dud
customer_reviews.text: I have always used HP printers but the last one just like this one was a dud. It only lasted a little over 2 years because of paper jams. After constantly jamming it would not work at all. The feature on this printer are great. I took a change and bought another one. The quality is great. Now I hope this one will last as long as the one I bought 6 years ago. They do not make the 8700 Pro anymore. And the others I have bought over the years that worked fine. Don't let me down HP.
customer_reviews.author: M. Bartos

customer_reviews.title: So glad our old printer died
customer_reviews.text: We had our old printer for only about five years and honestly I never liked it. I never fully understood how to use it and it was just a general pain. I was really bummed when it stopped working, but honestly I cannot believe the advances in printers in just five years. This printer is so easy to use. I had it fully set up in about 10 minutes. I use all of its functions seamlessly from any device. It's really amazing. And the price is so low for what you get. You should break your own printer and buy this one.
customer_reviews.author: Mom of 3

customer_reviews.title: Great printer --- not so great ink resupply program
customer_reviews.text: This printer is very good, and performs as promised. The only suggestion I have for HP is there ink replenishment program. It appears to automatically reorder ink on a regular cycle based on how many pages you "think" you will print, rather than being triggered by how many pages you have actually printed. My experience is that your guess will always be under or over actual pages printed, and you'll wind up with too much ink -- and it's expensive -- or running out. Great idea, poorly executed.
customer_reviews.author: SwitchTrack

customer_reviews.title: I love my HP 8720!
customer_reviews.text: I love my HP 8720, the best printer I've ever owned. Seriously simple to set-up. Plug it in and installed the app on my phone and answered a few questions. Have not had any of the wifi connection issues talked about here. It's a little overkill for home use but wouldn't trade it for another model. One warning, it does have a large footprint but if you have the space, go for it!
customer_reviews.author: Fog City Frank

customer_reviews.title: I guess I cant really speak for how the printer ...
customer_reviews.text: I guess I cant really speak for how the printer performs because i can't get it to be setup. the blue ink cartridge is damaged and the printer won't let me connect it to the internet or my computer until i get another cartridge, which i don't have. i've been on hold with hp customer service for about 20 minutes.
customer_reviews.author: Alicia Green

customer_reviews.title: A breeze to set up and use.....
customer_reviews.text: I was able to set up and start printing in about 15 minutes--that includes unboxing/assembling/downloading software. The quality is excellent--and I really like the fact that the printer can sense when ink levels are low and will automatically order refills. HP has really stepped up its game with the OfficeJet Pro 8720. I am a small business owner, and this printer is already a valuable asset.
customer_reviews.author: Diamond65

customer_reviews.title: Fast, sharp, and so easy to set up
customer_reviews.text: Right out of the box, this was an impressive upgrade from my Canon inkjet I had for a couple years. It was so easy to set up - one of the best tech user experiences I had. It worked instantly. It is crazy fast - I didn’t know inkjets could be that fast. And it has lots of great added features like being able to email attachments to the printer. If it holds up well enough, I may be an HP lifer now. The color printing looks great too.
customer_reviews.author: D Berkowitz

customer_reviews.title: Garbage. Designed to not work when ANY of 4 cartridges are empty
customer_reviews.text: I've got BLACK ink regular crap to print and I cant without replacing cyan, majenta,... unbe-freakn-leivable. Ive printed twice. You'd be better off getting chinese take-out, eating your meal, taking all wrappers and trash and stuffing it in the paper take-out container, shove a USB cord in there and see if it prints. Im taking my HP Officejet Pro 8720 and Im throwing it in the garbage.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Barnett

customer_reviews.title: Love this all-in-one!
customer_reviews.text: I recently grew tired of being cheap, buying $99 all-in-one machines at Target or Walmart. The HP OfficeJet Pro is amazing! Super fast printing, as well as WiFi hookup so you can print from any device, even a dedicated email right to the printer! Amazing. Love this machine, couldn't be happier.
customer_reviews.author: David J. Cameron

customer_reviews.title: printer crashes frequently. very unstable and unreliable firmware.
customer_reviews.text: About 50% of the time that I try to use this printer/scanner... a reboot is necessary to get it to function. When attempting to configure settings via the web interface... it will freeze up. Then when I try to reboot... it gets stuck shutting down to where pulling the power cord is necessary to get it to even shut off. Pretty much a piece of crap.
customer_reviews.author: Elden

customer_reviews.title: Although it's big and bulky I love this printer
customer_reviews.text: Although it's big and bulky I love this printer. The quality is their and pictures come out sharp and beautiful. The setup was easy and took about 20 minutes, give or take. I would recommend
customer_reviews.author: sherrie

customer_reviews.title: prints where you don't want it to, doesn't print where you do want it to
customer_reviews.text: This printer is enormous and noisy. I have had it only 3 months and It frequently prints a rectangular box of lines instead of printing what it should and as of this week it now it no longer prints along one edge of the paper and I can't return or replace it and as of 3 days ago I no longer qualify for any help.
customer_reviews.author: Shanon R. Mckenna

customer_reviews.title: Had correct manual and CD and was all wrapped up but didn't even look like right printer
customer_reviews.text: Had to return, box was missing items. Had correct manual and CD and was all wrapped up but didn't even look like right printer. Plus I ordered white and received a black printer. I returned it same day
customer_reviews.author: RTkeller

customer_reviews.title: Will NOT print on Cardstock.
customer_reviews.text: This is my first review I have written. The printer works fine when working with plain paper. However, it will not print on card stock at all. I of course did not know this till I attempted to print on it. I did all of the trouble shooting, called, and went online to find assistance. Nothing. Do not buy this if you would like to print business cards, or anything on card stock. HP was NOT helpful with the situation and now I am stuck with this useless printer. I cannot use it to the full extent it was described to me as when I bought it for my small business.
customer_reviews.author: Katie Monteleone

customer_reviews.title: Not sure about this!!
customer_reviews.text: I purchaced it through Amazon, but had a very difficult time getting the wireless to work. Spent a lot of $$$ to work out the details!! Don't know whether it was a reject that got recycled or what! Would have sent it back, but had destroyed the box! Mine was a lemon!! Trying to make lemon aid!!
customer_reviews.author: sweetie

customer_reviews.title: Very annoying. A lot of times it ends up printing ...
customer_reviews.text: Extremely frustrating!!!!! Printer hardly ever just prints when you click print, there is CONSTANTLY an issue where the HP print and scan doctor has to pop up and you have to "fix the issue". Very annoying . A lot of times it ends up printing twice because ofthis. Exremely disappointed for the price that i paid.
customer_reviews.author: Jamie

customer_reviews.title: I got a lot more for the money than I was expecting.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great printer. Bought it for my 8 person office and it does a great job so far. High quality prints, scanner works great, and simple set-up.
customer_reviews.author: Jana

customer_reviews.title: HP documentation sucks.
customer_reviews.text: Not the simplest thing to setup. It required lots of hand holding and you have to enter your wireless router's UserID and Pasword. Watch out for the HP support scammers.
customer_reviews.author: Harry E. Bunting

customer_reviews.title: Print quality and speed in great. Having a problem with the automatic document feeder ...
customer_reviews.text: Overall it's OK. Print quality and speed in great. Having a problem with the automatic document feeder jamming whenever I duplex scan a document that has a previous fold in it. For example, utility bills that were folded and mailed in an envelope jam almost every time. If the document has no fold impressions in it, the ADF works fine. Hum? I will be giving HP customer support a call on this one.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Lower your expectations before buying.
customer_reviews.text: Support window closed after 2 months, Return window was one month. Do not expect HP printers to work after that. I have 3 - HP 8720's. 2 get virtually no use, less than 50 pages since purchase. 1 Jams constantly (tried 2 different quality paper brands) checked all ports for pieces of paper, no explanation, makes grinding sound too, just lovely!
customer_reviews.author: HeiRai

customer_reviews.title: Still new but very pleased
customer_reviews.text: After years of flimsy printers all over the house, we bought this one and set it up in no time. It was a snap, even for a non-techy like me. Now all the computers and smartphones can print from this single, fast device. Double sided printing saves paper, a legal size scanner surface and more. Haven't tried all of the features, but so far, so very good
customer_reviews.author: Dressage lady

customer_reviews.title: ONE OF THE BEST - GOOD PERFORMANCE & GOOD PRICE
customer_reviews.text: EXCELLENT PRINTER... GREAT DUPLEXING (Do a lot of Tri-Folds and Graphics). The OfficeJet Pro-8720 certainly meet ALL my expectations; Very Good as an Office Printer. A Wonderful Performance Value at a relatively inexpensive price. I Give it Five (5) Stars!
customer_reviews.author: William C Gorski

customer_reviews.title: DONT BUY
customer_reviews.text: THIS PRINTER HAS CONNECTIVITY PROBLEMS DONT BUY. I previously spent an hour getting the printer all set up. Weeks later it decides not to print. I spent all evening messing with it, reinstalling software and it won’t print. The reviews are right, it has connectivity problems.
customer_reviews.author: chuck mahoney

customer_reviews.title: Constant Headache
customer_reviews.text: I am VERY dissatisfied with this printer. You cannot print in black ink only, ALL color cartridges have to be full in order to print. If one cartridge is empty, the printer will not work. It is very temperamental and will just stop printed and disconnect itself from the computer (if using wireless connection). If I could return it, I wouldn't hesitate.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley M Salisbury

customer_reviews.title: Junk Printer
customer_reviews.text: This printer is complete garbage. For the first year things were fine, with the occasional blurry printed page. As soon as the warranty expired I began having connectivity issues even though none of my internet hardware changed. I followed all of the steps given on the HP website and it would still drop connection once a week. Now, less than two years after purchasing the unit the display is completely unresponsive and I can't connect the printer to the internet. Stay away from HP products!
customer_reviews.author: Matthew T. Day

customer_reviews.title: Best Home Printer Yet
customer_reviews.text: A definite improvement on capabilities from the printer I bought from HP eight years ago. Excellent for my home application. I have now printed, scanned, faxed and copied from the printer. Well integrated to my laptop.
customer_reviews.author: HappyGuy

customer_reviews.title: ... my old HP with this pone hoping to get better results. Although it points ok I have a ...
customer_reviews.text: I replaced my old HP with this pone hoping to get better results. Although it points ok I have a stack of papers that didn't print well. Almost as though it was a misfeed or double printed. It only happen on the first page even if I am printing 3-4 pages or 1. I haven't call for support yet. Will update when I find a resolve.
customer_reviews.author: Gary

customer_reviews.title: HORRIBLE & DEFECTIVE...TWICE!
customer_reviews.text: DO NOT BUY! NO CUSTOMER SUPPORT. CARRIAGE DOES NOT MOVE TO ENABLE INK LOADING. THIS IS THE SECOND HP 8720 DEFECTIVE PRINTER SND IVE WASTED HOURS...Why can't i give it 0 stars?!?
customer_reviews.author: Jaypo

customer_reviews.title: Terrible- constant paper jams (100% paper jam on 2 sided ...
customer_reviews.text: Terrible- constant paper jams (100% paper jam on 2 sided printing), random disconnect on wireless, tilted/skewed scans (100% of the time)... all the problems others stated have happened with mine. Too late to return, so out the money and buying a replacement that will certainly not be HP brand.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonFan

customer_reviews.title: Frustrating
customer_reviews.text: I still havent been able to get this printer to install properly on wifi. Downloaded the newest drivers and software from HP and still have no working printer. The test page printed and it put so much ink on the paper that it bled through the page. I'm not happy so far
customer_reviews.author: Howard

customer_reviews.title: Good Printer
customer_reviews.text: Just as described on Amazon. It arrived undamaged, sealed in the original packaging. We have used it daily for a month in our home office. This printer connected wirelessly with our desktop PC and Surface on the first try. We have had several brief power outages, and this printer restarts and reconnects each time without any problems. The feeder has never jammed. Print, scan, and copy functions have all been tested (we don't hook up the fax). We deliberately declined the remote monitoring/auto-reorder for ink in the install process.
customer_reviews.author: Big Andy

customer_reviews.title: It's a good one!!!
customer_reviews.text: I read a lot of reviews and got a generally positive vibe about this printer. It has a lot of features that I have become used to, such as wireless printing, printing on both sides, etc. Some of the reviewers expressed problems with the initial setup, so I was a bit concerned, but I felt I could handle it. Well, it has been a couple of weeks and I LOVE IT!!! It replaces an HP printer that had been acting flaky for a long time, so I was anxious to have a printer that did what I wanted when I wanted it to. I checks all the boxes and them some.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Croswhite

customer_reviews.title: I bought this printer for school work and love the features
customer_reviews.text: I bought this printer for school work and love the features. The only two problems are duplex printing (two sided) has never worked; not a big deal for me. Also it jams when you print any thing besides best quality option (I use hp instant ink so I pay by the page effectively and the extra ink used is on hp ironically) but you have to remember to set it every time it's seems to default to quick print.
customer_reviews.author: Jay K.

customer_reviews.title: Missing cartridge had me worried but printer is good!!
customer_reviews.text: Ease in setting up. I was missing a cartridge when I got it. Luckily, there is a cartridge store near by. After that misstep everything was pretty straight forward. It’s kinda big. I like the white. It is a very quiet printer and the wireless feature is perfect for me. I print from my phone double sided and In color.
customer_reviews.author: Fresia Moore

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: This was an upgrade to a 5+ year old HP OfficeJet. They have since improved their ink cartridges and are cheaper and more efficient. I did my homework and this one has all the best features I need. It was easy to install... easy to use... prints quick and with almost picture perfect quality.
customer_reviews.author: DrGooseX

customer_reviews.title: Abysmal Print Quality
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this printer in September 2017 and it ran well on its original ink cartridges. This happy state of affairs lasted for around 5 months until we replaced ink cartridges. Quality steadily deteriorated till we replaced ink cartridges a 3rd time - since then all output has become unreadable despite numerous attempts at head cleaning and alignment. This extremely disappointing considering the initial outlay as well as the cost of replacement cartridges.
customer_reviews.author: Adrian Vella

customer_reviews.title: STAY AWAY
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this HP printer a few months ago and I would recommend you STAY AWAY from it. It come with only enough ink to set up the printer. With in two weeks you have to buy new ink. What nonsense, it's a scam! Then the Mac drivers have to be downloaded and the installation process is impossible to do with out tech support. I'm pretty good at home office (computer) set-ups, this was ridiculous. For a Mac go with Canon or Brothers.
customer_reviews.author: BP

product_meta.title: HP OfficeJet Pro 8720 All-in-One Wireless Printer, HP Instant Ink or Amazon Dash replenishment ready - White (M9L75A)
product_meta.description:
Color:White| Style:PrinterSatisfy office demands with HP Print Forward Design. Spend up to 50% less per page compared with lasers, and produce the color and black text output you need. Reduce paper use with blazing-fast two-sided printing from a printer made for high-volume offices. Get high speeds for two-sided print and scan jobs with laser-like paper handling, and preserve real estate with space-saving HP Print Forward Design. 

Print longer—without reloading—from an optional second paper tray. Keep business moving from anywhere in the office. Connect to devices with touch-to-print functionality. Easily print when and where you need to from your smartphone, tablet, or notebook PC—and maintain privacy. 

Stay productive with a large touchscreen and scan-to-network-folder-and-email capabilities that help you easily handle high-volume print jobs. Manage costs for a more efficient office with Color Usage Control. Operating temperature range - 41 to 104ºF
feature_bullets: Main functions of this color all-in-one wireless printer (black): copy, scan, fax, wireless printing, AirPrint, 2-sided duplex printing and scanning, color touchscreen, auto document feeder, Instant Ink ready so you'll never run out of ink, and more

Mobile printing: print from anywhere using your smartphone or tablet with the free HP ePrint app, easily print from your iPhone with AirPrint, print without a network using Wi-Fi Direct printing, touch to print with NFC capability
Up to 50% less cost per page than lasers with impressively fast print speeds, up to 24 pages per minute black

Space-saving HP Print Forward Design delivers laser-like paper handling and superfast print speeds. Breeze through multipage documents with two-sided scanning. Easily manage print jobs directly at the printer with the 4.3-inch touchscreen

Choose an ink replenishment service - Save up to 50% with HP Instant Ink or Save 10% on all reorders with Amazon Dash Replenishment. With Dash Replenishment, your printer detects when you are low and places a smart reorder. No subscription fees.
This all-in-one printer offers full support for productive, high-volume offices. This device is designed to print up to 2,000 pages per month for small workgroups of up to 5 users

Paper sizes supported: Letter; Legal; Government Legal; Executive; Statement; 3x5 in; 4x6 in; 5x7 in; 13x18 cm; 8x10 in; 10x15 cm; L; Photo 2L; Envelope (#10, Monarch, 5.5bar); Card (3x5 in, 4x6 in, 5x8 in)
One-year limited hardware warranty; 24-hour, 7 days a week Web support

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.7 out of 5 stars1,139 ratings3.7 out of 5 stars
